df-crcts
blocks.content: Define the set of all circuits (in an undirected graph). According to Wikipedia ("Cycle (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycle_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017): "A circuit can be a closed walk allowing repetitions of vertices but not edges"; according to Wikipedia ("Glossary of graph theory terms", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_graph_theory_terms, 3-Oct-2017): "A circuit may refer to ... a trail (a closed tour without repeated edges), ...". Following Bollobas ("A trail whose endvertices coincide (a closed trail) is called a circuit.", see Definition of [Bollobas] p. 5.), a circuit is a closed trail without repeated edges. So the circuit is also represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: df-cycls
blocks.content: Define the set of all (simple) cycles (in an undirected graph). According to Wikipedia ("Cycle (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycle_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017): "A simple cycle may be defined either as a closed walk with no repetitions of vertices and edges allowed, other than the repetition of the starting and ending vertex." According to Bollobas: "If a walk W = x0 x1 ... x(l) is such that l >= 3, x0=x(l), and the vertices x(i), 0 < i < l, are distinct from each other and x0, then W is said to be a cycle." See Definition of [Bollobas] p. 5. However, since a walk consisting of distinct vertices (except the first and the last vertex) is a path, a cycle can be defined as path whose first and last vertices coincide. So a cycle is represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: crcts
blocks.content: The set of circuits (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm crcts(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(ccrcts, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mptru(wceq(cfv(ccrcts, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0))))))))
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, ccrcts, c0, ctrls, wtru, wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))
  biidd(wa(wtru, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))
  a1i(wtru, wcel(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), universe))
  ssexi(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1))))
  wksv(s0, s1, c0)
  ssopab2i(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)))
  trliswlk(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))
  df-crcts(hs0, s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm crcts(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (Circuits ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß(s1 ` 0)=(s1 `(# ` s0)))}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mptru((Circuits ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß(s1 ` 0)=(s1 `(# ` s0)))})
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, ccrcts, c0, ctrls, wtru, (s1 ` 0)=(s1 `(# ` s0)), (s1 ` 0)=(s1 `(# ` s0)))
  biidd((T ‚àß hs0 = c0), (s1 ` 0)=(s1 `(# ` s0)))
  a1i(wtru, { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 } ‚àà ùïå)
  ssexi({ < s0, s1 > | s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 }, { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 })
  wksv(s0, s1, c0)
  ssopab2i(s0, s1, s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1)
  trliswlk(s0, c0, s1)
  df-crcts(hs0, s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs0.w((s1 ` 0)=(s1 `(# ` s0)))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: iscrct
blocks.content: Sufficient and necessary conditions for a pair of functions to be a circuit (in an undirected graph): A pair of function "is" (represents) a circuit iff it is a closed trail. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm iscrct(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cfv(ccrcts, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, ccrcts, c1, c2, ctrls, wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))
  crcts(hs1, hs0, c1)
  eqeq12d(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1))), cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))
  adantl(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(c2, nat0)))
  fveq1(cv(hs0), c2, nat0)
  fveq12d(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1)), c2, cfv(chash, c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  adantr(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs1)), cfv(chash, c0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c0, chash)
  reltrls(c1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iscrct(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[(Circuits ` c1)]c2 ‚Üî(c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2 ‚àß(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0))))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, ccrcts, c1, c2, ctrls, (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)), (hs0 ` 0)=(hs0 `(# ` hs1)))
  crcts(hs1, hs0, c1)
  eqeq12d((hs0 ` 0), (hs0 `(# ` hs1)), (c2 ` 0), (c2 `(# ` c0)), (hs1 = c0 ‚àß hs0 = c2))
  adantl(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2, (hs0 ` 0)=(c2 ` 0))
  fveq1(hs0, c2, nat0)
  fveq12d(hs0, (# ` hs1), c2, (# ` c0), (hs1 = c0 ‚àß hs0 = c2))
  simpr(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2)
  adantr(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2, (# ` hs1)=(# ` c0))
  fveq2(hs1, c0, chash)
  reltrls(c1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs1.w((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)))
  diff.hs0.w((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)))
}

blocks.name: iscycl
blocks.content: Sufficient and necessary conditions for a pair of functions to be a cycle (in an undirected graph): A pair of function "is" (represents) a cycle iff it is a closed path. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm iscycl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cfv(ccycls, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, ccycls, c1, c2, cpths, wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))
  cycls(hs1, hs0, c1)
  eqeq12d(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1))), cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))
  adantl(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(c2, nat0)))
  fveq1(cv(hs0), c2, nat0)
  fveq12d(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1)), c2, cfv(chash, c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  adantr(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs1)), cfv(chash, c0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c0, chash)
  relpths(c1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(cpths)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cpths)
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iscycl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[(Cycles ` c1)]c2 ‚Üî(c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2 ‚àß(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0))))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, ccycls, c1, c2, cpths, (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)), (hs0 ` 0)=(hs0 `(# ` hs1)))
  cycls(hs1, hs0, c1)
  eqeq12d((hs0 ` 0), (hs0 `(# ` hs1)), (c2 ` 0), (c2 `(# ` c0)), (hs1 = c0 ‚àß hs0 = c2))
  adantl(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2, (hs0 ` 0)=(c2 ` 0))
  fveq1(hs0, c2, nat0)
  fveq12d(hs0, (# ` hs1), c2, (# ` c0), (hs1 = c0 ‚àß hs0 = c2))
  simpr(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2)
  adantr(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2, (# ` hs1)=(# ` c0))
  fveq2(hs1, c0, chash)
  relpths(c1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(cpths)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cpths)
  diff.hs1.w((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)))
  diff.hs0.w((c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)))
}

blocks.name: crctprop
blocks.content: The properties of a circuit: A circuit is a closed trail. (Contributed by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: cyclprop
blocks.content: The properties of a cycle: A cycle is a closed path. (Contributed by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: crctisclwlk
blocks.content: A circuit is a closed walk. (Contributed by AV, 17-Feb-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: cyclnspth
blocks.content: A (non-trivial) cycle is not a simple path. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm cyclnspth(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wbr(c0, cfv(ccycls, c1), c2), wn(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2))))
} = {
  com12(wne(c0, emptycls), wbr(c0, cfv(ccycls, c1), c2), wn(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2)))
  sylbi(wbr(c0, cfv(ccycls, c1), c2), wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wn(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2))), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  iscycl(c0, c1, c2)
  impancom(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wne(c0, emptycls), wn(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2)))
  con2d(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls)), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2))
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls)), wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wn(wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0))
  biimpa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wb(wne(c0, emptycls), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0)), wcel(c0, universe))
  brrelex1i(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2)
  relpths(c1)
  bicomd(wcel(c0, universe), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0))
  necon3bid(cfv(chash, c0), nat0, c0, emptycls, wcel(c0, universe))
  hasheq0(c0, universe)
  expcom(wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wn(wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  neneqd(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0)))
  spthdep(c0, c1, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cyclnspth(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí(c0[(Cycles ` c1)]c2 ‚Üí ¬¨ c0[(SPaths ` c1)]c2))
} = {
  com12(c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, c0[(Cycles ` c1)]c2, ¬¨ c0[(SPaths ` c1)]c2)
  sylbi(c0[(Cycles ` c1)]c2, (c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí ¬¨ c0[(SPaths ` c1)]c2), (c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2 ‚àß(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0))))
  iscycl(c0, c1, c2)
  impancom(c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2, (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)), c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ¬¨ c0[(SPaths ` c1)]c2)
  con2d((c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2 ‚àß c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ), (c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0)), c0[(SPaths ` c1)]c2)

blocks.name: cyclispthon

blocks.name: usgrn2cycl
blocks.content: In a simple graph there are no cycles with length 2 (consisting of two edges). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 9-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 4-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: crctcshwlk
blocks.content: Cyclically shifting the indices of a circuit ` <. F , P >. ` results in a walk ` <. H , Q >. ` . (Contributed by AV, 10-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm crctcshwlk(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c5, cfv(ccrcts, c1), c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(chash, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, co(nat0, cfzo, c7)))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c5, ccsh, c8))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, co(nat0, cfz, c7), cif(cfv(c6, co(cv(s0), caddc, c8)), cfv(c6, co(co(cv(s0), caddc, c8), cmin, c7)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, co(c7, cmin, c8)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c8, nat0, w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))
  mpd(wa(w0, wceq(c8, nat0)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wa(wceq(c0, c5), wceq(c2, c6)))
  crctcshlem4(s0, c8, c0, c5, c2, c6, c3, c1, c4, c7, w0)
  adantr(w0, wceq(c8, nat0), wi(wa(wceq(c0, c5), wceq(c2, c6)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2)))
  syl5ibrcom(w0, wa(wceq(c0, c5), wceq(c2, c6)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wbr(c5, cfv(cwlks, c1), c6))
  3syl(w0, wbr(c5, cfv(cwlks, c1), c6), wbr(c5, cfv(ccrcts, c1), c6), wbr(c5, cfv(ctrls, c1), c6))
  crctistrl(c5, c1, c6)
  trliswlk(c5, c1, c6)
  breq12(c0, c5, c2, c6, cfv(cwlks, c1))
  crctcshwlkn0(s0, c8, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm crctcshwlk(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Vtx ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(iEdg ` c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5[(Circuits ` c1)]c6)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(# ` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c8 ‚àà(0[..^]c7))
  ‚ä£ c0 =(c5[cyclShift]c8)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(s0 ‚àà(0[...]c7)‚Ü¶ if(s0[‚â§](c7[-]c8),(c6 `(s0[+]c8)),(c6 `((s0[+]c8)[-]c7))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c8)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c8, nat0, w0, c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2)
  mpd((w0 ‚àß c8 = 0), c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2, (c0 = c5 ‚àß c2 = c6))
  crctcshlem4(s0, c8, c0, c5, c2, c6, c3, c1, c4, c7, w0)
  adantr(w0, c8 = 0, ((c0 = c5 ‚àß c2 = c6)‚Üí c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2))
  syl5ibrcom(w0, (c0 = c5 ‚àß c2 = c6), c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2, c5[(Walks ` c1)]c6)
  3syl(w0, c5[(Walks ` c1)]c6, c5[(Circuits ` c1)]c6, c5[(Trails ` c1)]c6)
  crctistrl(c5, c1, c6)
  trliswlk(c5, c1, c6)
  breq12(c0, c5, c2, c6, (Walks ` c1))
  crctcshwlkn0(s0, c8, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
}

thm crctcshtrl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Vtx ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(iEdg ` c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5[(Circuits ` c1)]c6)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(# ` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c8 ‚àà(0[..^]c7))
  ‚ä£ c0 =(c5[cyclShift]c8)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(s0 ‚àà(0[...]c7)‚Ü¶ if(s0[‚â§](c7[-]c8),(c6 `(s0[+]c8)),(c6 `((s0[+]c8)[-]c7))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c8)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  sylanbrc(w0, c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2, c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2, Fun(`' c0))
  crctcshwlk(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, w0)
  mpisyl(w0, Fun(`' c0), (c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)‚àß c8 ‚àà ‚Ñ§), c0 =(c5[cyclShift]c8))
  sylanbrc(w0, (c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)‚àß c8 ‚àà ‚Ñ§), (c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)), c8 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)
  3syl(w0, (c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)), c5[(Circuits ` c1)]c6, c5[(Trails ` c1)]c6)
  crctistrl(c5, c1, c6)
  syl(c5[(Trails ` c1)]c6, (c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)), (c5 :(0[..^](# ` c5))‚Ü£ dom(c4)))
  trlf1(c5, c1, c6, c4)
  sylbi((c5 :(0[..^](# ` c5))‚Ü£ dom(c4)), (c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)), ((c5 :(0[..^](# ` c5))‚Üí dom(c4))‚àß Fun(`' c5)))
  df-f1(c5, (0[..^](# ` c5)), dom(c4))
  anim1i((c5 :(0[..^](# ` c5))‚Üí dom(c4)), Fun(`' c5), c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4)))
  iswrdi(c5, (# ` c5), dom(c4))
  syl(w0, c8 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c8 ‚àà(0[..^]c7))
  elfzoelz(c8, nat0, c7)
  df-3an(c5 ‚àà Word(dom(c4)), Fun(`' c5), c8 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)
  cshinj(c5, dom(c4), c8, c0)
  istrl(c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: crctcsh
blocks.content: Cyclically shifting the indices of a circuit ` <. F , P >. ` results in a circuit ` <. H , Q >. ` . (Contributed by AV, 10-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 31-Oct-2021.)
